results.title: Understanding venereal disease
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw, Elaine Grand and Granada Television
results.brief_description: A round table discussion between a number of teenagers, a venereal disease specialist and Granada’s compere, is designed to inform teenagers about VD. Specifically informs on the types of VD, their known incidence in Britain, how to recognise symptoms, what should be done about it and where treatment may be obtained. The doctor states that early treatment is most necessary. The young people feel that information on VD should be given in schools as well as information on sex.

results.title: Understanding the Japanese
results.creator_credit: Shinichi Koike, Haruhiko Kawamura and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: A round-table social commentary by foreigners living in Japan including a professor and an employee of a Japanese company from Australia; a BBC producer as well as a freelance translater from England; a professor from Canada; and a lecturer of comparative culture from America.

results.title: Understanding the deaf (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows classroom activities in the Lutheran School for the Deaf in Detroit. Emphasises the teaching of speech, lip-reading, and language and shows the interaction of deaf children with their parents.

results.title: Understanding stresses and strains (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Hamilton Luske, Ken Peterson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Upjohn health series”.
Shows what excessive worry can do to mind and body, and suggests that using common sense can minimise the normal stresses and strains of life and keep all sides of the health triangle in balance.

results.title: Understanding soaps: a student and teacher's guide to learning about television
results.brief_description: This teachers information kit contains two video tapes and a thorough information exercise book. Its purpose is to enable students to gain some skills in media analysis. In this co-production between Channel 7 and renowned media teachers Barrie McMahon and Robyn Quin, soaps- specifically ‘Home and Away’, become the primary subject of study. Tape one covers basic production elements, characters, audiences and values. Tape two contains excerpts from ‘Home and Away’ for class discussion and analysis. The book contains foundation and advanced materials that can be used in a primary or secondary setting. The video’s are a good starting point for media education within a classroom setting.

results.title: Understanding Shakespeare: his stagecraft
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley, Gateway Educational Films and Murtin Productions
results.brief_description: Designed to show that the physical properties of the Elizabethan theatre materially affected the work of Elizabethan dramatists. Illustrates the features of the 16th century theatres. Extracts from Shakespeare’s plays are performed on a reconstruction of the stage of the Glove Theatre, showing the use of dramatic techniques.
results.creator_credit_for_label: W. Hugh Baddeley, Gateway Educational Films and Murtin Productions

results.title: Understanding Shakespeare: his sources
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley, George Murcell and Gateway Educational Films
results.brief_description: Designed to show how Shakespeare’s plays grew out of many elements available to him, elements that he fused together and developed in an unparalleled way. Shows the background of Elizabethan London. Includes extracts from Julius Caesar, Henry V, A Midsummer Night’s Dream and Hamlet, performed by members of St George’s Elizabethan Theatre Company.

results.title: Understanding ourselves: human heredity
results.brief_description: Illustrates the basic concepts of heredity in an easily understandable context. The mechanism whereby human characteristics are passed from generation to generation is discussed. The function of chromosomes, genes, and DNA in the heredity pattern is explained. Also considers the influence of temperament, behaviour and mutation.

results.title: Understanding our universe
results.brief_description: Discusses how man has learned about the universe from ancient times until the present days as well. Discusses some of our growing knowledge of the universe - the solar system, Milky Way, and countless other galaxies and nebulae that extend millions of light years into space.
